title: How to Knit the Perfect Scarf

steps.headline: Determine the size of your needles.
steps.description: Shopping: You can buy knitting needles and yarn at any craft store including Hobby Lobby, Walmart, Target, Ben Franklin, Michaels, etc.

steps.headline: Decide how many colors you want to include in your scarf.
steps.description: Are you a fan of dull or vibrant colors? This usually means two or more.

steps.headline: Determine the texture of your yarn.
steps.description: What kind of material do you prefer - baby soft or sparkly?

steps.headline: Decide how many stitches you want to include.
steps.description: This will ultimately determine how wide you want your width to be. (25 stitches works well.)

steps.headline: Make 25 loops and hook them onto one of the needles.
steps.description: This is the basis for your first row of stitches.

steps.headline: Holding the needle with stitches in your left hand, hold the free needle with your right hand.
steps.description: Let your pointer finger do the work. Slide the needle under the yarn and take it behind the left needle.

steps.headline: Wrap the yarn once around the needle going counter-clockwise.
steps.description: Make sure that the working needle is in the back so that it’s crossing.

steps.headline: Take the right needle and go under the yarn on the left needle and lift up until it comes off the needle.
steps.description: You have now completed one stitch.

steps.headline: Transition straight into the next row.
steps.description: It may feel like you are undoing your stitches by rotating them from one needle to the next, but after three or four rows you will notice your progress and hard work!

steps.headline: Continue this process for the remainder of the scarf.

text: Determine the size of your needles. Shopping: You can buy knitting needles and yarn at any craft store including Hobby Lobby, Walmart, Target, Ben Franklin, Michaels, etc. Decide how many colors you want to include in your scarf. Are you a fan of dull or vibrant colors? This usually means two or more. Determine the texture of your yarn. What kind of material do you prefer - baby soft or sparkly? Decide how many stitches you want to include. This will ultimately determine how wide you want your width to be. (25 stitches works well.) Make 25 loops and hook them onto one of the needles. This is the basis for your first row of stitches. Holding the needle with stitches in your left hand, hold the free needle with your right hand. Let your pointer finger do the work. Slide the needle under the yarn and take it behind the left needle. Wrap the yarn once around the needle going counter-clockwise. Make sure that the working needle is in the back so that it’s crossing. Take the right needle and go under the yarn on the left needle and lift up until it comes off the needle. You have now completed one stitch. Transition straight into the next row. It may feel like you are undoing your stitches by rotating them from one needle to the next, but after three or four rows you will notice your progress and hard work! Continue this process for the remainder of the scarf. Finished.
